newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.Africa to extradite Australian paedophile suspect.
newsitem.headline: S.Africa to extradite Australian paedophile suspect.

text.p: A South African court on Wednesday ordered that paedophile suspect Phillip Bell be extradited to Australia, where he is wanted in connection with 215 sex offences relating to boys aged 10 to 18.
His lawyer said he would appeal. "Australia wants this man, but the defence will be contesting a number of the charges against him," Jim Boyens said.
Bell, 62, was arrested after a 10-month worldwide police hunt in January in the popular South African holiday town of Jeffrey's Bay, where he was running a surfing school for youngsters.
Magistrate Flores van Zyl said in his 20-minute judgement there was enough evidence to warrant Bell's prosecution in Australia.
The extradition is subject to the final approval of Justice Minister Dullah Omar. Bell was granted 15 days to appeal against the judgement, but will remain in custody until Omar's decision.
The court rejected Bell's bail application last month, saying he was well enough connected round the world to stand a good chance of fleeing if freed.
